alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 1:26PM PST until January 18 at 7:40AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until 7 am pdt Wednesday. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 AM PST Tuesday was 23.1 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and will continue to slowly fall. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Coquille River Coquille 21.0 22.8 Tue 12 am PS 19.1 19.3 18.4 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM PST.
